docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 24 (AP) -- Uruguay imposed severe restrictions on the use of electricity today and the troubled country's 2.6-million citizens, already plagued by drought and inflation, faced a dark and bleak winter.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 24 (AP) -- Uruguay imposed severe restrictions on the use of electricity today and the troubled country's 2.6-million citizens, already plagued by drought and inflation, faced a dark and bleak winter.
docs.abstract: Pres Pacheco Areco signs exec order cutting elec power consumption in half starting May 27 because lack of rain lowers water level in major dam complex to critical levels

headline.main: URUGUAY RATIONS ELECTRIC POWER; Drought Causes New Crisis as Winter Approaches

docs.snippet: Stretching deep into the heart of South America, encompassing parts of Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil, Paraguay and Bolivia, is the potentially rich and fertile basin of the Rio de la Plata. By the end of this century, according to demographic studies,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Stretching deep into the heart of South America, encompassing parts of Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil, Paraguay and Bolivia, is the potentially rich and fertile basin of the Rio de la Plata. By the end of this century, according to demographic studies, more than 200 million people will live in the area. But unless a great transformation is wrought, they will live in the same grinding poverty as now prevails in the region.

headline.main: Rio de la Plata; A Vast Development Plan

docs.snippet: SANTA CRUZ, Bolivia, May 24 -- If the ghost of Ernesto Che Guevara lives on, it is not visible here, about 80 miles from the place where the guerrilla leader met his death last Oct. 9.

docs.abstract: Pol cult of Guevara seen alien to isolated eastern region in which he was killed; map; experts belief that band would have more success in adjacent populated areas noted; Barrientos warns of need to spur reforms to prevent future uprisings

headline.main: Cult of Guevara Seems Alien in Interior of Bolivia

docs.snippet: As vice chairman and United States representative of the International Dragon Class, as well as a Dragon sailor, I have noted the May 19 article about the controversy over the future of Olympic Games sailing because of the I.Y.R.U. recommendation...
docs.lead_paragraph: As vice chairman and United States representative of the International Dragon Class, as well as a Dragon sailor, I have noted the May 19 article about the controversy over the future of Olympic Games sailing because of the I.Y.R.U. recommendation that the Dragon and Star Classes be dropped from the 1972 Olympic Games.

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, May 26 -- The Foreign Ministers of four South American nations met here during the weekend to discuss progress on a road some 3,000 miles long that would open the jungle-covered heartlands of South America.

docs.snippet: IT is generally assumed that Latin American countries have a brighter future than they have had a past. Yet if there is anywhere a country that might legitimately feel nostalgic for the good old days, it is Uruguay. A civilized, peacefully prosperous...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT is generally assumed that Latin American countries have a brighter future than they have had a past. Yet if there is anywhere a country that might legitimately feel nostalgic for the good old days, it is Uruguay. A civilized, peacefully prosperous welfare state (of sorts) 20 years ago,
